item.description:
@CoreVersion wrote:

Well, i’m not entirely sure what you mean, but i found an anoying way to fix it, and that is to manually put it into the cape slot, every time i want to put one on…making it very difficult if people want to put them on -.-

item.title: DEATH CAPE! code is wrong?
item.dc:creator: @Sun_Chips Sun Chips
item.description:
@Sun_Chips wrote:

this code is not effecting the slot it goes into as this is client side.
You want server side, so find Item.java(it might be called something else), and add another item id to the cape array.

item.title: DEATH CAPE! code is wrong?
item.dc:creator: @CoreVersion CoreVersion
item.description:
@CoreVersion wrote:

Can somebody tell me why this code, seems to put the DeathCape into the weapon position, rather than the cape position?
Can you maby edit it for me? then re post? thanks.
}
if(i == 9119)
{
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wear”;
class8.anIntArray156 = new int[5];
class8.anIntArray160 = new int[5];
class8.anInt174 = 3288; //Inv & Ground
class8.anInt181 = 2000; //Zoom
class8.anInt190 = 500;
class8.anInt198 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = -6;
class8.anInt194 = 1;
class8.anInt204 = 14;
class8.anInt165 = 3287;
class8.anInt200 = 3287;
class8.anInt175 = -1;
class8.anInt197 = -1;
class8.anInt199 = -1;
class8.aString170 = “Death Cape”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “The cape worn by masters of PKing.”.getBytes();
